subject: Programming
title: The HealthCare.gov Launch Disaster
description: A fast breakdown of The HealthCare.gov Launch Disaster for builders.

hook.text: On October 1, 2013, the US launched HealthCare.gov. It crashed almost immediately.

buildup.text: The site was supposed to serve millions of Americans shopping for health insurance.

discovery.text: Only six people managed to enroll on the first day. The site could handle just 1,100 users.

twist.text: Fifty-five contractors built pieces that were never properly integrated or load-tested.

climax.text: A rescue team of top engineers rebuilt the site in weeks, saving the entire program.

punchline.text: The biggest launch failure became a rescue story.

quiz.question: How many people enrolled on HealthCare.gov's first day?
